application.name: ringsmappt
application.brief: Outputs ring radius/longitude at line/sample or reverse

description.p: The ringsmappt application computes various coordinate formats using a map-projected cube.

The following table shows input parameters and the resulting coordinates that will be computed:
Input Parameters Coordinates Computed
Line and sample Ring radius, ring longitude, X, and Y
Ring radius and ring longitude Line, sample, X, and Y
X and Y Line, sample, ring radius, and ring longitude

The output options are the following:
Display to the screen only
PVL format text file
Comma delimited text file or flat file

The output file (TO) can be used as input to extract keyword values with a script via the getkey program. Below is an example of the command line to execute the program, and the results that show the keywords and the computed values:
ringsmappt from=W1591159850_1_cal.lev2.cub sample=1024 line=1024
Group = Results Filename = W1591159850_1_cal.lev2.cub Sample = 1024.0 Line = 1024.0 PixelValue = 2.9266113e+11 X = -58752169.950728 Y = -83725336.55945 RingRadius = 102282693.82409
# Input map direction/domain for ring longitude. CounterClockwise360RingLongitude = 234.9416974425 Clockwise360RingLongitude = 125.0583025575 CounterClockwise180RingLongitude = -125.0583025575 Clockwise180RingLongitude = 125.0583025575 End_Group

The user can specify how the program interprets the rings longitude domain and rings longitude direction by defining the coordinate system parameters (COORDSYS). The ring longitude direction can be set to clockwise or counterclockwise.

history.change: Modified results PVL to not include the results group
Changed name to mappt and made ui look like skypt and campt
Changed flatfile output so it duplicates PVL data. User now required to enter a flatfile name.
Added pixel value to the output group
Modified output to include all coordinate systems for latitude and longitude and clearly declare the input files coordinate system. Improved documentation.
Added many parameters accessible when inputting a lat and lon, all under coordinate system. These parameters are to select the input coordinate system being used. Updated documentation to match.
Changed to use TProjection instead of Projection. References #775
Changed to work for ring plane projections. References #775
Added appTests. Test coverage 96% scope, 94% line, 67% function. Function coverage is low since there are GUI helper methods.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: Specify an input cube that contains Mapping group keywords in the labels.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: Output filename that contains the results of ringsmappt. This file can be used in conjunction with the getkey program to pass the results to another program when developing scripts, if the PVL format is selected.

parameter.name: FORMAT
parameter.description: The format type for the output file. The default is in PVL format.

option.description: Output file is a comma delimited text file with column headings. This file format can easily be imported into the Microsoft Excel program or other spreadsheets.

parameter.name: APPEND
parameter.description: If this option is selected, the output from ringsmappt will be appended to the output file. If it is not selected, any information in the TO file will be overwritten.

parameter.name: TYPE

option.description: This option interprets the coordinate as sample/line and will compute ring radius/ring longitude, and X/Y

option.brief: Interprets the coordinates as ring radius and ring longitude
option.description: This option interprets the coordinate as ring radius/ring longitude and will compute sample/line and X/Y
This option interprets the coordinate as X/Y and will compute sample/line and ring radius/ring longitude

parameter.description: This parameter is used to select the type of input coordinate. The options are IMAGE (sample/line), GROUND (ring radius/ring longitude), and PROJECTION (X/Y).

parameter.name: SAMPLE
parameter.description: This is the sample position used to compute information about the camera state at the pixel level.

parameter.name: LINE
parameter.description: This is the line position used to compute information about the camera state at the pixel level.

parameter.name: RINGRADIUS
parameter.description: This is the ring radius value to use for the target.

parameter.name: RINGLONGITUDE
parameter.description: This is the ring longitude value. The ring longitude will be interpreted as either CounterClockwise or Clockwise, and as -180° to 180° or 0° to 360° ring longitude domain, depending on the option selected under coordinate system.

parameter.name: X
parameter.description: This is the X coordinate value in meters.

parameter.name: Y
parameter.description: This is the Y coordinate value in meters.

parameter.name: COORDSYS
parameter.brief: The coordinate system of the ring radius and ring longitude
parameter.description: This is the coordinate system that the input ring radius and ring longitude will be interpreted in. There are four possible options that include using the input cube settings, the ISIS defaults, user defined settings, or an existing map file template. The values will be interpreted as counterclockwise or clockwise, and -180° to 180° or 0° to 360° rings longitude domain.

option.brief: Use coordinate system of input file
option.description: This option uses the coordinate system of the input cube; this could be any of four possibilities. This is the default behavior.
The ISIS default coordinate system of counterclockwise ring longitude direction and rings longitude domain 0° to 360°.
The user defines the rings longitude direction and rings longitude domain for the coordinate system.

option.brief: Use mapping group from another file
option.description: Use an existing file (NOT THE INPUT FILE) with Mapping group information to determine the coordinate system for the computations.

parameter.name: MAP
parameter.description: This file can be a cube or a user generated map file template, but not the input file. This file must contain the mapping group and is used to determine the coordinate system, if selected.

helper.name: H1
helper.description: This help button will display the mapping group of the selected Map File to the session log of the application

parameter.name: RINGLONDIR
parameter.description: This is the ring longitude direction for the projection. The direction can be Counterclockwise or Clockwise. COUNTERCLOCKWISE is the default.

option.description: Sets the ring longitude direction of the input to be interpreted as CounterClockwise.
Sets the ring longitude direction of the input to be interpreted as Clockwise.

parameter.name: RINGLONDOM
parameter.description: The ring longitude domain for the projection can either be 180 or 360. The default setting is 360.

option.description: Sets the ring longitude domain of the input to be interpreted as 0 to 360 degrees.
Sets the ring longitude domain of the input to be interpreted as -180 to 180 degrees.
